sections.name: The Stabbing Beast
sections.text:
The Stabbing Beast, the divine representative of Norgorber, resembles an immense scorpion with a soft and strangely captivating voice. They appear on Golarion to bury secrets, support the faithful, or aid audacious thefts.

Recall Knowledge - Fiend (Religion): DC 44

sources.name: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven

link.name: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 85

sections.name: Heralds
sections.text: Nearly all deities have a specific representative known as a herald; heralds are as diverse in their appearances and abilities as the gods themselves. A creature with the herald type is always unique. The Stabbing Beast has been slain before—Norgorber is always swift to replace it with a new Stabbing Beast, allowing the new version to retain memories of the prior version's defeats to spur the herald on to do better in its new incarnation.

sources.name: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Fiend
traits.text: Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere.

traits.name: Herald
traits.text: Nearly all deities have a specific representative known as a herald; heralds are as diverse in their appearances and abilities as the gods themselves. A creature with the herald type is always unique.

sources.name: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven

link.name: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven pg. 85

interaction_abilities.name: Trigger
interaction_abilities.text: The Stabbing Beast is transformed with Change Shape and rolls for initiative;

interaction_abilities.name: Effect
interaction_abilities.text: The Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

modifiers.name: +2 status to all saves vs. mental

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: pincer +29 [+25/+21] (agile, finesse, magical, reach 15 feet), Damage 2d8+10 slashing plus 2d8 persistent bleed and Improved Grab

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: stinger +29 [+24/+19] (fatal d12, finesse, magical, reach 15 feet), Damage 4d8+14 piercing plus Stabbing Beast venom

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: shortsword +30 [+26/+22] (agile, finesse, magical, versatile S), Damage 3d6+10 piercing plus 2d8 persistent bleed

offensive_actions.name: Ranged
offensive_actions.text: venom stream +29 [+24/+19] (range increment 60 feet), Damage 5d10 poison plus blinding stream

offensive_actions.name: Divine Innate Spells
offensive_actions.text: DC 36; 6thmodify memory (×3); 5thdimension door (×3), summon animal (×3; scorpions only); 4thcharm (at will), invisibility (×3), suggestion (at will); Constant(7th)true seeing

offensive_actions.name: Blinding Stream
offensive_actions.text: A creature hit by the Stabbing Beast's venom stream must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or become blinded for 1d4 rounds.

offensive_actions.name: Change Shape
offensive_actions.text: The Stabbing Beast takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid with a scorpion's tail and chitinous, full-body plate armor. This doesn't change their Speed or Strikes, except that their reach becomes 5 feet and they can't make pincer Strikes.

offensive_actions.name: Conjure Swords
offensive_actions.text: Requirements The Stabbing Beast is using Change Shape; Effect The Stabbing Beast summons one or two +2 greater striking keen shortswords into their hands. These weapons disappear if they leave the Stabbing Beast's grasp or if the Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

offensive_actions.name: Stabbing Beast Venom
offensive_actions.text: While a creature is enfeebled from this poison, it is doomed 1; Saving Throw DC 36; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 3d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round); Stage 2 4d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round); Stage 3 6d6 poison damage and enfeebled 3 (1 round)
